member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.API.IModularOverhaulApi.RegisterCustomSkillForPrestige(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a flag to allow the specified SpaceCore skill to level past 10 and offer prestige professions.
member.remarks: All this does is increase the level cap for the skill with the specified . The custom Skill mod author is responsible for making sure their professions return the correct description and icon when prestiged. To check if a instance has a given prestiged profession, simply add 100 to the profession's base ID.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.BloodthirstyEnchantment
member.summary: Attacks on-hit heal for 10% of damage dealt. Excess healing is converted into a shield for up to 20% of (the player's) max health, which slowly decays after not dealing or taking damage for 25s.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.CarvingEnchantment
member.summary: Attacks on-hit reduce enemy defense, down to a minimum of -1. Armored enemies (i.e., Armored Bugs and shelled Rock Crabs) lose their armor upon hitting 0 defense.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.CleavingEnchantment
member.summary: Attacks on-hit spread 60% - 20% (based on distance) of the damage to other enemies around the player.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.EnergizedEnchantment
member.summary: Moving and attacking generates Energize stacks, up to 100. At maximum stacks, the next attack causes an electric discharge, dealing heavy damage in a large area.
member.remarks: 6 charges per hit + 1 charge per 6 tiles traveled.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.EnergizedEnchantment.MaxEnergy
member.summary: The amount of energy stacks when fully charged.

member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current number of energy stacks.

member.summary: Updates the instance state.
member.param: The number of ticks elapsed since the game started, including the current tick.

member.summary: Trigger a lightning strike on the specified 's position.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.ExplosiveEnchantment
member.summary: Absorbs and stores energy from enemy hits (before mitigation). The next special move releases the accumulated energy as an explosion.
member.remarks: 6 charges per hit + 1 charge per 6 tiles traveled.

member.summary: The highest amount of damage that can be accumulated.

member.summary: The amount of damage accumulation required to increase the explosion radius by 1 tile.

member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the total accumulated damage.

member.summary: Gets the largest possible explosion radius.

member.summary: Updates the instance state.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Enchantments.Melee.MammoniteEnchantment
member.summary: Attacks that would leave an enemy below 10% max health immediately execute the enemy, converting the remaining health into gold. Consecutive kills without taking damage increase the threshold by 1%.

member.summary: Improves weapon special moves.

member.summary: Causes a random unpredictable effect.
member.remarks: Can spawn illegal items.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config
member.summary: The user-configurable settings for PROFS.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PrestigeProgressionStyle
member.summary: The style used to indicate Skill Reset progression.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PrestigeProgressionStyle.StackedStars
member.summary: Use stacked quality star icons, one per reset level.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PrestigeProgressionStyle.Gen3Ribbons
member.summary: Use Generation 3 Pokemon contest ribbons.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PrestigeProgressionStyle.Gen4Ribbons
member.summary: Use Generation 4 Pokemon contest ribbons.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ModKey
member.summary: Gets mod key used by Prospector and Scavenger professions.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ShouldJunimosInheritProfessions
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether determines whether Harvester and Agriculturist perks should apply to crops harvested by Junimos.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LaxOwnershipRequirements
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether if enabled, machine and building ownership will be ignored when determining whether to apply profession bonuses.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ArtisanGoodsAlwaysInputQuality
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the quality of produced artisan goods should be always the same as the quality of the input material. If set to false, then the quality will be less than or equal to that of the input.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.CustomArtisanMachines
member.summary: Gets custom mod Artisan machines. Add to this list to make them compatible with the profession.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.BeesAreAnimals
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Bee House products should be affected by Producer bonuses.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ForagesNeededForBestQuality
member.summary: Gets the number of items that must be foraged before foraged items become iridium-quality.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.MineralsNeededForBestQuality
member.summary: Gets the number of minerals that must be mined before mined minerals become iridium-quality.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.TrackingPointerScale
member.summary: Gets the size of the pointer used to track objects by Prospector and Scavenger professions.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.TrackingPointerBobRate
member.summary: Gets the speed at which the tracking pointer bounces up and down (higher is faster).

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.DisableAlwaysTrack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether if enabled, Prospector and Scavenger will only track off-screen object while is held.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ChanceToStartTreasureHunt
member.summary: Gets the chance that a scavenger or prospector hunt will trigger in the right conditions.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.AllowScavengerHuntsOnFarm
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether determines whether a Scavenger Hunt can trigger while entering a farm map.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ScavengerHuntHandicap
member.summary: Gets a multiplier which is used to extend the duration of Scavenger hunts, in case you feel they end too quickly.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ProspectorHuntHandicap
member.summary: Gets a multiplier which is used to extend the duration of Prospector hunts, in case you feel they end too quickly.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.TreasureDetectionDistance
member.summary: Gets the minimum distance to the treasure hunt target before the indicator appears.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.SpelunkerSpeedCeiling
member.summary: Gets the maximum speed bonus a Spelunker can reach.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.EnableGetExcited
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether toggles the Get Excited buff when a Demolitionist is hit by an explosion.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.CrystalariumsUpgradeWithGemologist
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to increase the quality of all active Crystalarium minerals when the Gemologist owner gains a quality level-up.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.FishNeededForInstantCatch
member.summary: Gets the number of fish species that must be caught to achieve instant catch.
member.remarks: Unused.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.AnglerPriceBonusCeiling
member.summary: Gets the maximum multiplier that will be added to fish sold by Angler. if multiple new fish mods are installed, you may want to adjust this to a sensible value.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.AquaristFishPondCeiling
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of Fish Ponds that will be counted for catching bar loss compensation.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ShowFishCollectionMaxIcon
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to display the MAX icon below fish in the Collections Menu which have been caught at the maximum size.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LegendaryPondPopulationCeiling
member.summary: Gets the maximum population of Aquarist Fish Ponds with legendary fish.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.TrashNeededPerTaxDeductionPct
member.summary: Gets you must collect this many junk items from crab pots for every 1% of tax deduction the following season.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.TrashNeededPerFriendshipPoint
member.summary: Gets you must collect this many junk items from crab pots for every 1 point of friendship towards villagers.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ConservationistTaxBonusCeiling
member.summary: Gets the maximum income deduction allowed by the Ferngill Revenue Service.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PiperBuffCeiling
member.summary: Gets the maximum stacks that can be gained for each buff stat.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.EnableLimitBreaks
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to allow Limit Breaks to be used in-game.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitBreakKey
member.summary: Gets the mod key used to activate the Limit Break. Can be the same as .

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.HoldKeyToLimitBreak
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Limit Break is activated by holding the , as opposed to simply pressing.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitBreakHoldDelaySeconds
member.summary: Gets how long the should be held to activate the Limit Break, in seconds.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitGainFactor
member.summary: Gets the rate at which one builds the Limit gauge. Increase this if you feel the gauge raises too slowly.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitDrainFactor
member.summary: Gets the rate at which the Limit gauge depletes during Ultimate. Decrease this to make the Limit Break last longer.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitRespecCost
member.summary: Gets monetary cost of changing the chosen Limit Break. Set to 0 to change for free.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitGaugeXOffset
member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate of the Limit Gauge.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.LimitGaugeYOffset
member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate of the Limit Gauge.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.EnablePrestige
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to apply Prestige changes.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.SkillResetCostMultiplier
member.summary: Gets the base skill reset cost multiplier. Set to 0 to reset for free.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ForgetRecipes
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether resetting a skill also clears all corresponding recipes.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.AllowMultiplePrestige
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the player can use the Statue of Prestige more than once per day.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PrestigeExpMultiplier
member.summary: Gets cumulative multiplier to each skill's experience gain after a respective skill reset.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.RequiredExpPerExtendedLevel
member.summary: Gets how much skill experience is required for each level up beyond 10.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.PrestigeRespecCost
member.summary: Gets monetary cost of respecing prestige profession choices for a skill. Set to 0 to respec for free.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.BaseSkillExpMultipliers
member.summary: Gets a multiplier that will be applied to all skill experience gained from the start of the game.
member.remarks: The order is Farming, Fishing, Foraging, Mining, Combat and Luck (if installed).

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.CustomSkillExpMultipliers
member.summary: Gets multiplies all skill experience gained from the start of the game, for custom skills.

member.name: P:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Professions.Config.ProgressionStyle
member.summary: Gets the style of the sprite that appears next to skill bars. Accepted values: "StackedStars", "Gen3Ribbons", "Gen4Ribbons".

member.summary: Forcefully set the 's stats to the default values from the game's data.

member.summary: Forcefully randomizes the 's stats according the player's current progression.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.State
member.summary: The runtime state variables for WPNZ.

member.name: T:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.Virtue
member.summary: Represents one of the five heroic virtues.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.Virtue.Honor
member.summary: Honor cannot be purchased. Honor also cannot be sold, for its value is greater than all the treasure in the world. Yet one can lose it, and whoever does so shall have sullied his name for all eternity. A truly honorable man always stands behind his actions, faces every challenge and refuses to lie.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.Virtue.Compassion
member.summary: There are many traits that bear witness to a man's true nature. Compassion is what separates men from beasts. Whoever feels sympathy for his fellow man will never turn a blind eye to misfortune. He will always stand in defense of the wronged.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.Virtue.Wisdom
member.summary: Wisdom is a virtue which one should strive to cultivate throughout one's life, for it is impossible to be so wise one cannot become even wiser. The wise know this... As we journey through life, we should seek to make wise choices Remember, wise choices are not those which make our lives easier or simpler. Often, they make them more complicated. But always, they make us better.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.Virtue.Generosity
member.summary: No man can be called good who does not share his prosperity with others. Generosity is required for dignity in life and peace in death.

member.name: F:DaLion.Overhaul.Modules.Weapons.Virtue.Valor
member.summary: Valor does not make one good, yet how many good men have you met in your life's journey who were cowards? Those who posses valor do not hesitate to stand against the majority, no matter what the consequences.

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Dialogue_Clint_Blueprint_Notdone
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Hey @. I'm still not done deciphering that blueprint of yours.$0#$b#Maybe tomorrow...$2".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Dialogue_Clint_Blueprint_Done
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Hey @. I finished translating that old blueprint.$0#$b#Sorry it took so long.$2#$b#It turned out to be a recipe for a weapon made out of some strange materials.$0#$b#Whoever wrote it clearly was a master blacksmith. The techniques described in here are quite remarkable.$2#$b#I'd actually love to have a go at making this, but I've no idea where to find these materials.#$b#Anyway, here's your book back. If you do come across this stuff bring it back here and I'll make you that weapon for free.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Dialogue_Gil_Virtues
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "A true adventurer should live by the Five Heroic Virtues: Honor, Compassion, Wisdom, Generosity and Valor. Those who do are deemed heroes in the eyes of Yoba, bound to always return safely from their adventures.#$b#At least that's what my momma used to say.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Locations_Town_DwarfGrave_Translated
member.summary:
Get a translation equivalent to " You translate the dwarvish: 

midst golden triplets lost in sand
bring forth a rainbow forged from land
beseech the heavens! stake thy claim
let thunders bruit and roar thy name
if heart be pure and conscious clear
and faith hath neither doubt nor fear
stars shall rain down yonder seal
and bestow thee with heaven steel".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Virtues_Honor_Flavor
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to ""Honor cannot be purchased. Honor also cannot be sold, for its value is greater than all the treasure in the world. Yet one can lose it, and whoever does so shall have sullied his name for all eternity. A truly honorable person always stands behind their actions, faces every challenge and refuses to lie."".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Virtues_Compassion_Flavor
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to ""There are many traits that bear witness to a person's true nature. Compassion is what separates men from beasts. Whoever feels sympathy for their fellow man will never turn a blind eye to misfortune. They will always stand in defense of the wronged."".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Virtues_Wisdom_Flavor
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to ""Wisdom is a virtue which one should strive to cultivate throughout one's life, for it is impossible to be so wise one cannot become even wiser. The wise know this... As we journey through life, we should seek to make wise choices. Remember, wise choices are not those which make our lives easier or simpler. Often, they make them more complicated. But always, they make us better."".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Virtues_Generosity_Flavor
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to ""No person can be called good who does not share their prosperity with others. Generosity is required for dignity in life and peace in death."".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Virtues_Valor_Flavor
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to ""Valor does not make one good, yet how many good men have you met in your life's journey who were cowards? Those who posses valor do not hesitate to stand against the majority, no matter the consequences."".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Algae
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Algae".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Core_Choose
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Choose the modules to enable. You must save and exit this menu after enabling or disabling a module for those changes to take effect. Links to specific module settings pages will appear below for enabled modules.\n\nNote that certain modules may cause a JSON shuffle or other side-effects if enabled or disabled mid-playthrough.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Core_Modules
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Module settings:".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Profs_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Professions".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Profs_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Overhauls professions with the goal of supporting more diverse and interesting playstyles. Introduces all-new Prestige mechanics and Limit Breaks for combat professions.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Cmbt_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Combat".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Cmbt_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Overhauls general combat mechanics with the goal of improving underwhelming combat stats. Emphasis on a multiplicative defense algorithm, and knockback collision damage.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Wpnz_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Weapons".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Wpnz_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Overhauls all aspects of melee weapons. Rebalances weapons according to new color-coded tiers, introduces combo mechanics, swords with a stabbing special move, and many other features.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Slngs_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Slingshots".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Slngs_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Overhauls slingshots to bring them up to par with melee weapons. Introduces ranged critical strikes, slingshot enchantments, a stunning smack special move, and more.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Tols_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Tools".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Tols_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "A one-stop-shop for tool augmentation, customization and quality-of-life. Adds charging to resource tools, automatic tool selection, expanded tool enchantments, among other features.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Ench_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Enchantments".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Ench_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "A complete overhaul of combat enchantments. Replaces boring vanilla weapon enchantments with entirely new and more interesting ones, while also introducing slingshot-specific enchantments.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Rngs_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Rings".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Rngs_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Snap your enemies to oblivion with the powerful new Infinity Band, which draws inspiration from real Music Theory to create a more balanced and immersive mechanic for combining multiple rings.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Pnds_Name
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Ponds".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Pnds_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "Makes Fish Ponds great again, allowing roe products to scale in quality and quantity among other rebalances and new mechanics.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Txs_Desc
member.summary: Get a translation equivalent to "A borderline realistic taxation system for added challenge and end-game gold sink.".

member.name: M:DaLion.Overhaul.I18n.Gmcm_Modules_Twx_Desc

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.Automate.IMachine.MachineTypeID
member.summary: Gets a unique ID for the machine type.
member.remarks: This value should be identical for two machines if they have the exact same behavior and input logic. For example, if one machine in a group can't process input due to missing items, Automate will skip any other empty machines of that type in the same group since it assumes they need the same inputs.

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.GenericModConfigMenu.IGenericModConfigMenuOptionsApi.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Valid values for the alignment parameter of AddHorizontalSeparator and AddSimpleHorizontalSeparator.
Add a Color option at the current position in the GMCM form.
member.param: Get the current value from the mod config.
Set a new value in the mod config.
The label text to show in the form.
The tooltip text shown when the cursor hovers on the field, or null to disable the tooltip.
Whether the color picker should allow setting the Alpha channel.
A flags to control how the color picker is rendered.
The unique field ID for use with GMCM's OnFieldChanged, or null to auto-generate a randomized ID.

member.summary: Add an image picker option. This is really an "array index picker" where you can specify what to draw for each index. The underlying value is always a uint (the index).
member.param: Get the current value from the mod config.
Set a new value in the mod config.
The label text to show in the form.

The maximum value this option can have, and thus the maximum value that will be passed to and . Note that this is a function, so theoretically the number of options does not have to be fixed. Should this function return a value greater than the option's current value then the option's current value will be clamped. In common usage, this parameter should be a function that returns one less than the number of images.

A function that returns the maximum image height. Used to report the option's height to GMCM (which before version 1.8.2 will not recompute how much space to reserve for the option until the page is re-opened) and to center arrows vertically in the Sides arrow placement option.
A function that returns the maximum image width. This is used to place the arrows and label.
A function which draws the image for the given index at the given location.
The tooltip text shown when the cursor hovers on the field, or null to disable the tooltip.
A function to return the string to display given the image index, or null to disable that display.
Where to render the arrows. Use a value from the ImageOptionArrowLocation enum.
Where to render the label. Use a value from the ImageOptionLabelLocation enum.
The unique field ID for use with GMCM's OnFieldChanged, or null to auto-generate a randomized ID.

member.summary: Add an image picker option. A simplified interface to the full AddImageOption signature. To use this signature, you supply a function that returns an array of tuples containing the different image . The underlying value is the uint that is the index of the selected image.
member.param: Get the current value from the mod config.
Set a new value in the mod config.
The label text to show in the form.

A function that returns an array of tuples describing the image choices. Each tuple contains:
A function to return the label string (or null for no label)
The Texture2D containing the image (i.e., the sprite sheet)
The source rectangle for the image within the texture, or null to indicate the entire texture
The tooltip text shown when the cursor hovers on the field, or null to disable the tooltip.
Where to render the arrows. Use a value from the ImageOptionArrowLocation enum.
Where to render the label. Use a value from the ImageOptionLabelLocation enum.
The unique field ID for use with GMCM's OnFieldChanged, or null to auto-generate a randomized ID.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.GenericModConfigMenu.IGenericModConfigMenuOptionsApi.AddHorizontalSeparator(StardewModdingAPI.IManifest,System.Func{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color},System.Func{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color})
member.summary: Add a horizontal separator.
member.param: A function that returns the fraction of the GMCM window that the separator should occupy. 1.0 is the entire window. Defaults to 0.85.

How much padding (in pixels) to place above the separator.
How much padding (in pixels) to place below the separator.
The horizontal alignment of the separator. Use a value from the HorizontalAlignment enumeration.
A function to return the color to use for the separator. Defaults to the game's text color.
A function to return the color to use for the shadow drawn under the separator. Defaults to the game's text shadow color. Return Color.Transparent to remove the shadow completely.

How much padding (in pixels) to place below the separator.
The horizontal alignment of the separator. Use a value from the HorizontalAlignment enumeration.
The color to use for the separator. Defaults to the game's text color.
The color to use for the shadow drawn under the separator. Defaults to the game's text shadow color. Use Color.Transparent to remove the shadow completely.

member.summary: Add an option at the current position in the form using custom rendering logic.

A callback raised just before the menu containing this option is opened.

A callback raised before the form is reset to its default values (i.e. before the reset callback passed to ).
A callback raised after the form is reset to its default values (i.e. after the reset callback passed to ).
A callback raised just before the menu containing this option is closed.
The pixel height to allocate for the option in the form, or null for a standard input-sized option. This is called and cached each time the form is opened.
The unique field ID for use with , or null to auto-generate a randomized ID.
member.remarks: The custom logic represented by the callback parameters is responsible for managing its own state if needed. For example, you can store state in a static field or use closures to use a state variable.

the player accessing the inventory, or null if no player is involved.

member.summary: Whether or not a mutex is required for interacting with this object's inventory. You should always use a mutex to ensure items are handled safely with multiplayer, but in case you're doing something exceptional and Better Crafting should not worry about locking, you can explicitly disable mutex handling.

the player accessing the inventory, or null if no player is involved.

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient
member.summary:
An IIngredient represents a single ingredient used when crafting a recipe. An ingredient can be an item, a currency, or anything else.
The API provides methods for getting basic item and currency ingredients, so you need not use this unless you're doing something fancy.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.SupportsQuality
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether gets whether or not this IIngredient supports quality control options, including using low quality first and limiting the maximum quality to use.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the name of this ingredient to be displayed in the menu.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.Texture
member.summary: Gets the texture to use when drawing this ingredient in the menu.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.SourceRectangle
member.summary: Gets the source rectangle to use when drawing this ingredient in the menu.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.Quantity
member.summary: Gets the amount of this ingredient required to perform a craft.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.GetAvailableQuantity(StardewValley.Farmer,System.Collections.Generic.IList{StardewValley.Item},System.Collections.Generic.IList{DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IInventory},System.Int32)
member.summary: Determine how much of this ingredient is available for crafting both in the player's inventory and in the other inventories.
member.param: A list of all available s across all available instances. If you only support consuming ingredients from certain IInventory types, you should not use this value and instead iterate over the inventories. Please note that this does not include the player's inventory.
The maximum item quality we are allowed to count. This cannot be ignored unless returns false.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IIngredient.Consume(StardewValley.Farmer,System.Collections.Generic.IList{DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IInventory},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Consume this ingredient out of the player's inventory and the other available inventories.
member.param: The maximum item quality we are allowed to count. This cannot be ignored unless returns false.
Whether or not we should make an effort to consume lower quality ingredients before consuming higher quality ingredients.

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent
member.summary: This event is dispatched by Better Crafting whenever a player performs a craft, and may be fired multiple times in quick succession if a player is performing bulk crafting.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent.Player
member.summary: Gets the player performing the craft.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the item being crafted, may be null depending on the recipe.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent.Menu
member.summary: Gets the BetterCraftingPage menu instance that the player is crafting from.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the craft, marking it as a failure. The ingredients will not be consumed and the player will not receive the item.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent.Complete
member.summary: Complete the craft, marking it as a success. The ingredients will be consumed and the player will receive the item, if there is one.

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe
member.summary: An IRecipe represents a single crafting recipe, though it need not be associated with a vanilla . Recipes usually produce s, but they are not required to do so.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.SortValue
member.summary: Gets an additional sorting value to apply to recipes in the Better Crafting menu. Applied before other forms of sorting.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.Name
member.summary: Gets the internal name of the recipe. For standard recipes, this matches the name of the recipe used in the player's cookingRecipes / craftingRecipes dictionaries. For non-standard recipes, this can be anything as long as it's unique, and it's recommended to prefix the names with your mod's unique ID to ensure uniqueness.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets a name displayed to the user.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.Description
member.summary: Gets an optional description of the recipe displayed on its tooltip.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.CraftingRecipe
member.summary: Gets the vanilla CraftingRecipe instance for this recipe, if one exists. This may be used for interoperability with some other mods, but is not required.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.HasRecipe(StardewValley.Farmer)
member.summary: Whether or not the player knows this recipe.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.CanCraft(StardewValley.Farmer)
member.summary: Check to see if the given player can currently craft this recipe. This method is suitable for checking external conditions. For example, the add-on for crafting buildings from the crafting menu uses this to check that the current allows building.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.GetTooltipExtra(StardewValley.Farmer)
member.summary: An optional, extra string to appear on item tooltips. This can be used for displaying error messages to the user, or anything else that would be relevant. For example, the add-on for crafting buildings uses this to display error messages telling users why they are unable to craft a building, if they cannot.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.CreateItem
member.summary: Create an instance of the Item this recipe crafts, if this recipe crafts an item. Returning null is perfectly acceptable.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipe.PerformCraft(DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPerformCraftEvent)
member.summary: This method is called when performing a craft, and can be used to perform asynchronous actions or other additional logic as required. While crafting is taking place, Better Crafting will hold locks on every inventory involved. You should ideally do as little work here as possible.
member.param: Details about the event, and methods for telling Better Crafting when the craft has succeeded or failed.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IRecipeProvider.RecipePriority
member.summary: Gets the priority of this recipe provider, for sorting purposes. When handling CraftingRecipe instances, the first provider to return a result is used.

member.summary: Get any additional recipes in IRecipe form. Additional recipes are those recipes not included in the `CraftingRecipe.cookingRecipes` and `CraftingRecipe.craftingRecipes` objects.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCraftingMenu.Standalone

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCraftingMenu.Working
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether whether or not the menu is actively crafting something. This will only return true when a craft is happening, or when the menu is waiting for an asynchronous craft to return.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCraftingMenu.ActiveRecipe
member.summary: Gets get the current recipe. This is normally the recipe that the player's cursor is hovering over, but when performing a craft or when the bulk crafting menu is open, it will return the relevant recipe.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCraftingMenu.ToggleEditMode

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPopulateContainersEvent
member.summary: This event is emitted by whenever a new Better Crafting menu is opened, and serves to allow other mods to add or remove specific containers from a menu.

member.name: P:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IPopulateContainersEvent.Menu
member.summary: Gets the relevant Better Crafting menu.

member.name: E:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCrafting.MenuPopulateContainers
member.summary: This event is fired whenever a new Better Crafting menu is opened, allowing other mods to manipulate the list of containers.

Try to open the Better Crafting menu. This may fail if there is another menu open that cannot be replaced.
If opening the menu from an object in the world, such as a workbench, its location and tile position can be provided for automatic detection of nearby chests.
Better Crafting has its own handling of mutexes, so please do not worry about locking Chests before handing them off to the menu.
When discovering additional containers, Better Crafting scans all tiles around each of its existing known containers. If a location and position for the menu source is provided, the tiles around that position will be scanned as well.
Discovery depends on the user's settings, though at a minimum a 3x3 area will be scanned to mimic the scanning radius of the vanilla workbench.
member.param: If true, open the cooking menu. If false, open the crafting menu.
If true, do not make a sound upon opening the menu.
The map the associated object is in, or null if there is no object.
The tile position the associated object is at, or null if there is no object.
The tile area the associated object covers, or null if there is no object or if the object only covers a single tile.
If true, attempt to discover additional material containers.
An optional list of containers to draw extra crafting materials from.
An optional list of recipes by name. If provided, only these recipes will be listed in the crafting menu.
member.returns: Whether or not the menu was opened successfully.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCrafting.GetMenuType
member.summary: Return the Better Crafting menu's type. In case you want to do spooky stuff to it, I guess.
member.returns: The BetterCraftingMenu type.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCrafting.GetActiveMenu
member.summary: Get the currently open Better Crafting menu. This may be null if the menu is still opening.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCrafting.CreateErrorIngredient
member.summary: Create a simple that does not match anything but requires a quantity of one, thus always preventing a recipe from being crafted. It displays as an error item in the ingredients list.
Consume matching items from a player, and also from a set of instances. This is a helper method for building custom s.
member.param: An enumeration of tuples where the function matches items, and the integer is the quantity to consume.
The player to consume items from, if any. Items are consumed from the player's inventory first.
An enumeration of instances to consume items from, such as the one passed to .
Whether or not to consume low quality items first.

The name of a recipe to use as the category's default icon.

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Integrations.BetterCrafting.IBetterCraftingApi
member.summary: The API provided by Better Crafting.

Try to open the Better Crafting menu. This may fail if there is another menu open that cannot be replaced. If opening the menu from an object in the world, such as a workbench, its location and tile position can be provided for automatic detection of nearby chests. Better Crafting has its own handling of mutexes, so please do not worry about locking Chests before handing them off to the menu. When discovering additional containers, Better Crafting scans all tiles around each of its existing known containers. If a location and position for the menu source is provided, the tiles around that position will be scanned as well. Discovery depends on the user's settings, though at a minimum a 3x3 area will be scanned to mimic the scanning radius of the vanilla workbench.
member.param: If true, open the cooking menu. If false, open the crafting menu.
If true, do not make a sound upon opening the menu.
The map the associated object is in, or null if there is no object.
The tile position the associated object is at, or null if there is no object.
The tile area the associated object covers, or null if there is no object or if the object only covers a single tile.
If true, attempt to discover additional material containers.
An optional list of containers to draw extra crafting materials from.
An optional list of recipes by name. If provided, only these recipes will be listed in the crafting menu.
member.returns: Whether or not the menu was opened successfully.

member.name: T:DaLion.Shared.Caching.IntervalMemoryCache`2
member.summary: A memory cache with sliding expiry based on custom intervals, with no background processing.
member.typeparam: The cache key type.
The cache value type.
member.remarks: This is optimized for small caches that are reset relatively rarely. Each cache entry is marked as hot (accessed since the interval started) or stale. When a new interval is started, stale entries are cleared and hot entries become stale. Pulled from SMAPI.

member.name: F:DaLion.Shared.Caching.IntervalMemoryCache`2._hotCache
member.summary: The cached values that were accessed during the current interval.

member.name: F:DaLion.Shared.Caching.IntervalMemoryCache`2._staleCache
member.summary: The cached values that will expire on the next interval.

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Caching.IntervalMemoryCache`2.GetOrSet(`0,System.Func{`1})
member.summary: Get a value from the cache, fetching it first if needed.
member.param: The unique key for the cached value.
A delegate for getting the latest data if it's not in the cache yet.
member.returns: The cached value corresponding to the given .

member.name: M:DaLion.Shared.Caching.IntervalMemoryCache`2.StartNewInterval
member.summary: Start a new cache interval, removing any stale entries.
